DOC.brief_title: Continuous Glucose Sensor Profiles Non-Diabetic Subjects
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . After initial eligibility determine , informed consent assent obtain parent/guardian subject . 2 . Subjects follow test perform : - Hemoglobin A1c ( use DCA2000 equivalent device ) - Oral glucose tolerance test obtain fast 2 hour plasma glucose level - Anti-GAD , anti-IA2 anti-insulin antibody - Subjects HbA1c > 6.0 % and/or fast glucose level > 100 and/or 2 hour glucose level > 140 discontinue study . 3 . Subjects normal A1c glucose level provide RT-CGM home glucose meter ( HGM ) 4 . An RT-CGM sensor insert initiated study personnel . 5 . Subjects would like wear 2 sensor give 2 type RT-CGM . 6 . Subjects instruct wear sensor 3-7 day ( depend type device ) measure blood glucose HGM need calibrate sensor . 7 . Subjects return clinical center 3-7 day sensor wear return RT-CGM HGM . - If subject less 48 hour sensor data ask wear another sensor return 3-7 day later .
DOC.criteria: Age > 8 year Body mass index ( BMI ) 10th 90th percentile age sex ( base CDC , 2000 nomogram ) < 28 kg body weight/meter adult subject No significant chronic illness take acute chronic medication might affect glucose metabolism . History diabetes positive islet cell antibody test
